summary: This is an FBI News Briefing dated December 8, 2020, covering a wide range of topics including leading news, protests, counter-terrorism, counter-intelligence, criminal investigations, financial crime, cyber division, law enforcement services, international relations, lawful access, other FBI news, and other Washington news. It includes a specific section on Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys seeking bail, noting her deteriorating jail conditions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Onetime girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein; her attorneys are seeking her release on bail, claiming she has lost weight and hair under onerous jail conditions.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who made claims about Maxwell's deteriorating health in jail.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Judge who will decide later in the month whether to conduct a hearing on Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the former partner of Ghislaine Maxwell; his suicide in a federal lockup is cited as a reason for Maxwell's strict jail conditions.

persons.name: Chris Hacker
persons.context: FBI Special Agent in Charge who stated the FBI is not focused on peaceful protests but on those inciting violence, in relation to Georgia-related federal prosecutions.

persons.name: Paul Torino
persons.context: Member of the Atlanta Anti-Repression Committee claiming some Georgia-related federal prosecutions aim to blunt future protests.

persons.name: Brian Dugan
persons.context: Veteran FBI agent appointed by Director Christopher Wray to head the FBI's Norfolk field office.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: FBI Director who tapped Brian Dugan as the new Special Agent in Charge of the Norfolk, Virginia field office.

persons.name: Martin Culbreth
persons.role: Former FBI Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Former head of the FBI's Norfolk office who retired in October 2020.

persons.name: Dan Genck
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Assistant Special Agent in Charge for the New Orleans Field Office, discussing Zoom hacking involving child sexual abuse material.

persons.name: Eric B. Smith
persons.context: FBI Special Agent who commented on the FBI's efforts to educate the elderly about financial scams like the 'grandparent scam'.

persons.name: John Gainer
persons.context: FBI agent who discussed common themes in Minnesota bank robberies and ATM burglaries.

persons.name: Sandra Yi Barker
persons.context: FBI Public Affairs Specialist who confirmed an ongoing death investigation on the Crow Indian Reservation.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Personal attorney for President Trump hospitalized with coronavirus, prompting concern for legislators he interacted with.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned frequently in political and election-related news; his legal efforts to overturn election results are a major topic.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Frequently mentioned as the winner of the 2020 presidential election; his transition and cabinet selections are covered.

connections.description: Described as the onetime girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein.
Bobbi Sternheim is a defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her bail application.
FBI Director Christopher Wray appointed Brian Dugan as the new Special Agent in Charge of the Norfolk field office.
Rudy Giuliani is identified as President Trump's personal attorney involved in legal efforts to challenge election results.

events.title: FBI News Briefing Publication
events.description: Daily intelligence briefing covering a wide array of national and international news, including criminal investigations and political developments.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Bail Renewal
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers renewed her application for release on bail, citing deteriorating health and onerous jail conditions.

events.title: Maxwell Lawyers' Letter
events.description: Two of Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers wrote a letter renewing her bail application after compiling new information.

events.title: Rudy Giuliani Hospitalized with COVID-19
events.description: Rudy Giuliani, President Trump's personal attorney, was hospitalized after testing positive for coronavirus, raising concerns about exposure to legislators.

events.title: Brian Dugan Appointed Norfolk SAC
events.description: FBI Director Christopher Wray appointed veteran agent Brian Dugan as the new Special Agent in Charge of the FBI's Norfolk field office.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys are seeking her release on bail, claiming she has lost weight and hair under strict jail conditions imposed partly due to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
The FBI News Briefing is a comprehensive daily digest covering topics from criminal investigations and counter-terrorism to political news and international relations.
FBI Director Christopher Wray appointed Brian Dugan as the new Special Agent in Charge of the Norfolk, Virginia field office.
Rudy Giuliani's hospitalization with COVID-19 prompted concerns about potential exposure to legislators he recently met with while not wearing a mask.
The document includes a section on criminal investigations noting the FBI's involvement in various cases, including a death on the Crow Indian Reservation and a missing Florida teacher.
